byline.contributor: Bhadra Sharma reported from Kathmandu, and Ellen Barry from New Delhi.
byline.original: By BHADRA SHARMA and ELLEN BARRY

abstract: Nepal Parliament elects K P Sharma Oli as prime minister; election takes place amid unrest in country due to disagreements over its new constitution, and as tensions have arisen between Nepal and India over fuel tankers not being allowed to cross border, which has led to shortages of gas and fuel in Nepal.
lead_paragraph: Politics in the country have been upended by protests by ethnic Madhesi groups in the south who are demanding revisions to the Constitution.

headline.main: Nepal Elects K.P. Sharma Oli as New Prime Minister
headline.print_headline: Nepal Elects New Premier Amid Worries Over Fuel, the Constitution and India

snippet: Politics in the country have been upended by protests by ethnic Madhesi groups in the south who are demanding revisions to the Constitution.
